> Subject: [junit]
>
> We've started using JunitEE to unit test our J2EE current development,
and
> are looking at doing an automated overnight build and test.
>
> I have a TestAll test suite, itself built from a series of test
suites,
> each of which is built from test classes, with the aim of testing the
> entire application from one class. This works fine when the TestAll
suite
> is manually selected from a menu presented in an HTML screen.
>
> With JUnit, I wrote a short batch file containing an ANT command line
to
> build and test the entire application. With the JUnitEE TestAll suite
> normally activated from the browser, I'm stuck as to how to automate
my
> TestAll suite to run overnight.
>
> Has anyone else come out with a solution to this problem ? Or am I on
the
> wrong track here ? I am looking at using Cactus, but at present most
of
> our unit testing is testing the home interfaces at CMP level, and I
don't
> think Cactus is appropriate for this.

It is. Have a look at : http://jakarta.apache.org/cactus/howto_ejb.html

BTW JUnitEE and Cactus work in the same way except :
- Cactus has more redirectors,
- Cactus has a client part that is used to automate the tests and
interface with JUnit Test Runners (any of them).

BTW, there is also a tutorial that explains how JUnitEE and Cactus could
be used together on http://jakarta.apache.org/cactus/howto_junitee.html

>
> Thanks for your help.
>
> Scott
